title: Shirley Horn - Light out of Darkness (A Tribute to Ray Charles)
description:
MP3/320kbps

The stunning Light Out of Darkness is at once Shirley Horn&#039;s loving tribute to the genius of Ray Charles, a stylistic departure from the introspective jazz balladry she&#039;s known for, and a journey into the world of R&B. Horn and her trio swing hard on these tracks, and the organic R&B tinged jazz arrangements absolutely simmer, with Horn singing, playing piano, and Hammond B-3 organ. Her distinctive sultry and smoky vocals are bluesy and conversational, similar in approach to Charles&#039;. Horn&#039;s masterly chord cluster style of piano playing punctuates her every vocal phrase.

Personnel: Shirley Horn (vocals, piano, organ); Gary Bartz (alto saxophone); Charles Ables (guitar, bass); Tyler Mitchell (bass); Steve Williams (drums); The Hornettes (background vocals).

Recorded at Clinton Recording Studios, New York, New York, from April-May 1993.

Track listing:
1.Hit the Road Jack (Percy Mayfield) (3:11)
2.Just a Little Lovin&#039; (Eddy Arnold, Zeke Clements)(4:07)
3.You Don&#039;t Know Me (Eddy Arnold, Cindy Walker) (2:58)
4.Drown in My Own Tears (Henry Glover) (5:04)
5.Hard Hearted Hannah (Milton Ager, Bob Bigelow)(3:36)
6.Georgia on My Mind (Hoagy Carmichael, Stuart Gorrell)(5:20)
7.Makin&#039; Whoopee (Walter Donaldson, Gus Kahn)(3:54)
8.Green (It&#039;s Not Easy Being Green) (3:16)
9.Bye Bye Love (Felice Bryant, Boudleaux Bryant)(5:26)
10.The Sun Died (Ray Charles)  (5:39)
11.How Long Has This Been Going On? (George Gershwin, Ira Gershwin)(4:01)
12.If You Were Mine 	(Jimmy Lewis)(3:25)
